definition: to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Sequence analysis showed that it contained the basic characteristic of primary structure of promoter.
sentences.chinese: 对其序列分析表明它具有启动子初级结构的基本特征。

sentences.english: It offers the theoretical foundation for the use of this endosperm specific promoter.
sentences.chinese: 为这一胚乳特异启动子的广泛利用提供了理论依据。

sentences.english: We have constructed suitable screening method for low-temperature sensitive promoters.
sentences.chinese: 建立了简便的双层平板诱导法对启动子进行初筛。

sentences.english: Promoter sequence of the gene's upstream was forecasted by bioinformatic method.
sentences.chinese: 结合生物信息学方法分析预测基因上游的启动子序列。

sentences.english: Enhancer is a cis-function element that increased the function of promoter in eukaryotic cells.
sentences.chinese: 增强子是真核细胞中增强启动子功能的顺式作用元件。

sentences.english: NZB mice may have deletion in promotor region of Fcgr2b gene.
sentences.chinese: NZB小鼠该基因启动子区可能存在碱基缺失。

sentences.english: Distinguish between the function of promoters and enhancers in transcriptional regulation.
sentences.chinese: 区分启动子与增强子在转录调节中的作用。

sentences.english: For example, an invoke activity might be re-executed and, for instance, a sub process is started a second time.
sentences.chinese: 例如，可能重新执行调用活动，并再次启动子流程。

sentences.english: Fr Rutten was the great promoter of all these.
sentences.chinese: 神父鲁滕是所有这些伟大的启动子。

sentences.english: The gene silence of XAF1 is related with the hypermethylation of its promotor .
sentences.chinese: XAF1的基因沉默与其启动子高甲基化明显相关。

definition: allele (one of two paired gene in diploid organism)
cytosine nucleotide (C, pairs with guanine G 鳥嘌呤|鸟嘌呤 in DNA and RNA)
transcription/to make a copy of a recording
